column4: It doesn't even install ndiswrapper. How the heck am I supposed to download ndiswrapper if I don't have an internet connection?
I'm rapidly becoming disenchanted with ubuntu.
I might actually degrade, because at least then I could connect to the internet.
ndiswrapper is on both the live & alternate CDs, last time I checked.
Not installed by default, but installable without an internet connection.
You probably need ndiswrapper-utils-1.8 or something.
If you're using a Feisty livecd, make that ndiswrapper-utils-1.9
In fact, you might want to check the ndiswrapper wiki page:     *

In fact, you might want to check the ndiswrapper wiki page:           Without an Internet connection, you can still install ndiswrapper-utils from the Desktop CD. If you installed from that, the repository in which ndiswrapper-utils is found is on the CD, but not within the live session. You need to boot into your new Ubuntu installation and then reinsert the Desktop CD. You will be asked if you want to add the packages on the CD ...
Ok, I'll just write out the address: help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/Ndiswrapper
The first time I stuck my cd in on my new installation, sure, it asked me if I wanted to add it. I clicked yes. But lo and behold, that has done me jack shit.;
If you've got the CD added as a repository, you *should* just be able to apt-get install ndiswrapper-utils-1.9
Otherwise, there'll be the .deb of it lying around on the CD somewhere.  You could "find / -iname *.deb"
That's quite true.  It looks like you need to use the alternate cd, which is a bit strange.
